p: Plant-derived polymers contain different phenolic compounds including flavonoids and polyphenols as bioactive compounds. These bioactive compounds prevent the chain propagation reactions originated by free radical reactions and prevent disease-related oxidative damage [ 83, 84, 85, 86]. Sangeethapriya and Siddhuraju [ 78] studied the antioxidant activity of the polyphenols isolated from Zizyphus mauritiana fruit mucilage against DPPH- 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl is 5.27 g mucilage/g DPPH, superoxide is 85.12%, ABTS- 2,2-azino-bis-3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulphonic acid is 16587.32 mmol Trolox Eq./g, and hydroxyl is 76.13%. Sardarodiyan et al. [ 87] also studied the antioxidant activity and total phenolic compounds of Lallemantia royleana seed mucilage and in their study, they observed antioxidant activity of 528.54 μg/mL of DPPH and total phenolic content of 82.56 ± 1.6 μg/GAE. In two different studies done by Jouki et al. [ 80] and Silveira Coelho et al. [ 88] the antioxidant property of Quince seed and phenolic content of chia seeds were 29.88% and 641.71 μg/GAE, respectively.
